channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: JBL Bar 500MK2 Review: A Fantastic Soundbar System
item.description: This compact 2.1 soundbar system offers realistic Dolby Atmos surround sound.

item.title: Apple pauses app store changes in Texas after court blocks age assurance law
item.description: Apple said it will pause its plans for compliance with the new law in Texas but notes other age assurance tech remains available to developers.

item.title: Un iPhone pliant à imprimer en 3D pour patienter avant le modèle d’Apple
item.description: La pression monte autour de l'iPhone pliant ! Les rumeurs en sont persuadées, Apple lancerait cet appareil inédit dans la gamme aux alentours de septembre prochain. Pour ceux qui n'en peuvent plus d'attendre, il est toujours possible de se faire une idée du design (supposé) de l'appareil.

item.title: The ‘Pluribus’ Finale’s Big Twist Is the Perfect Set-Up for Its Next Chapter
item.description: Carol and Manousos finally meet in the season one finale of Apple TV’s sci-fi hit—and now, the agonizing wait for season two begins.

item.title: Forget the Love Story—This Holiday Rom-Com Is a Fantasy for Environmentalists
item.description: Don't watch "A Merry Little Ex-Mas" for the cheesy romance. Watch it for the sustainability messages, which shine as bright as LED Christmas lights.

item.title: Sony’s souped-up PlayStation 5 Pro is $100 off for the rest of today
item.description: Sony’s full suite of PlayStation 5 consoles jumped in price in August due to increased US tariffs, but now through Christmas, you can save $100 on several models. This discount is especially great if you planned to go big with Sony’s PS5 Pro, the company’s priciest, most powerful console yet. Normally $749.99, you can currently […]

item.description: Here is the full list of the agtech and food tech Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: How much RAM do you actually need? I did the research so you don't overspend
item.description: A quick and easy-to-follow guide to determine how much RAM your system should have for work and gaming.

item.title: NYT Connections hints and answers for Thursday, December 25 (game #928)
item.description: Looking for NYT Connections answers and hints? Here's all you need to know to solve today's game, plus my commentary on the puzzles.

item.description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

item.title: Abonnés Free Mobile : cette option méconnue permet de changer de numéro sans nouvelle SIM
item.description: C'est une option qui existe depuis des années, mais que tout le monde semble avoir oubliée. Free permet de changer de numéro de téléphone en quelques clics. Pas de changement de forfait, pas de nouvelle carte SIM à attendre dans la boîte aux lettres. C'est simple, rapide, mais ça peut transformer votre vie numérique en enfer administratif si vous ne faites pas attention. ...

item.title: Ce smartphone Android avec écran Oled 120 Hz et charge 68 W est à moitié prix sur le site officiel du fabricant
item.description: Depuis l'arrivée de son successeur, le Motorola Edge 50 Neo est un bon milieu de gamme qui ne cesse de voir son prix baisser. Aujourd'hui, il est à son prix le plus bas : 229 euros au lieu de 499 euros à sa sortie.

item.title: Nike shares are up after Apple CEO Tim Cook buys $3 million in stock
item.description: Nike shares rose 2% in premarket trading. Nike shares ticked up 2% in premarket trading on Wednesday after Apple CEO Tim Cook bought nearly $3 million worth of the sportswear maker’s stock.

item.title: This Prime Video exclusive Christmas anime is a heartwrenching coming of age story featuring a distractingly buff Santa Claus
item.description: I love unhinged Christmas anime Sanda, on Amazon Prime Video, but it's not for the faint of heart

item.title: This 3D-printed iPhone Fold mockup might be as close as you can come to holding the real thing
item.description: Someone took apparently leaked iPhone Fold CAD plans and turned them into a 3D print.

item.title: Holiday treats recalled from stores nationwide: Don’t let these mislabeled products spoil your Christmas party
item.description: FDA notices posted just days before Christmas identify a number of potentially harmful products, including holiday barks sold at Aldi grocery stores. During the week of Christmas, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has announced food recalls for several holiday treats.

item.title: Italy tells Meta to suspend its policy that bans rival AI chatbots from WhatsApp
item.description: Italy has ordered Meta to suspend its policy that bans companies from using WhatsApp's business tools to offer their own AI chatbots on the popular chat app.

item.title: StubHub’s ChatGPT app turns ticket hunting into a conversation
item.description: StubHub has launched a conversational ticket‑finding app inside ChatGPT

item.title: Christmas Eve storms in Southern California have officials urging travelers to reconsider holiday plans
item.description: Winter storms are expected to intensify into Christmas Eve. California officials and weather forecasters urged holiday travelers to avoid the roads and reconsider Christmas travel as a series of powerful winter storms brought relentless rains, heavy winds and mountain snow.Storms began to move in late Tuesday evening and were expected to intensify into Christmas Eve. Authorities said the millions of people expected to travel across the state will likely meet hazardous, if not impossible, conditions as several atmospheric rivers were forecast to make their way through the state, the National We...

item.title: Pro-Russian hacker group claims responsibility for DDoS attack on French postal service
item.description: A pro-Russian hacker group has come forward as the perpetrator of a DDoS attack on the French national postal service La Poste that took place on December 22, according to Reuters. The distributed denial-of-service attack took central computer systems at La Poste entirely offline and caused major disruptions in package deliveries just days before Christmas. Reuters reported that the cyberattack on La Poste was still not fully resolved as of Wednesday morning. While regular letters were not affected, postal workers were unable to track packages and online payments through La Banque Postale, the...

item.title: How to track Santa Claus this Christmas Eve using AI
item.description: If you’re a parent with young children, then you’ll probably hear this a lot on Christmas Eve: “Where’s Santa right now?” With tracking tools like the NORAD Santa Tracker and Google’s Santa Tracker, everyone can know when Father Christmas will arrive. Plus, there are now some new AI tools to bring the holiday magic. Here’s […]

item.title: My favorite camera for 2025 was the finest stills camera I’ve ever held — the stunning Hasselblad X2D II
item.description: The Hasselblad X2D II the finest camera for photography ever made – for outright image quality at least – and it also saw a welcome price drop from its predecessor.

item.title: Aflac reveals personal data of 22.6 million people stolen in cyberattack - here's what we know
item.description: Six months after the breach, Aflac determines how many people are affected and starts reaching out.

item.title: Altman: Once upon a time, Google could have dominated OpenAI
item.description: The great-power competition in the AI Age will likely pit OpenAI against Google. The great power competition in the AI Age will probably be between OpenAI and Google, and one of the main battles may be over advertising dollars. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman seemed to describe the world in those terms during an appearance on the Big Technology podcast Monday....

item.title: How a ’60 Minutes’ segment on Trump immigration policy accidentally aired online
item.description: A controversial immigration story was pulled from one of Canada’s largest networks, but still ran on its app. A news segment about the Trump administration’s immigration policy that was abruptly pulled from “60 Minutes” was mistakenly aired on a TV app after the last minute decision not to air it touched off a public debate about journalistic independence.The segment featured interviews with migrants who were sent to a notorious El Salvador prison called the Terrorism Confinement Center, or CECOT, under President Donald Trump’s aggressive crackdown on immigration.The story was pulled from Glob...

item.title: Orange fait un cadeau surprise aux Livebox 4 et 5 (mais il peut brider votre Wi-Fi)
item.description: C'est une mise à jour aussi discrète qu'importante. Orange a commencé à déployer une nouvelle fonctionnalité sur ses anciennes Livebox 4 et 5, ainsi que sur les modèles Sosh, pour réduire leur consommation électrique. Attention, cette économie d'énergie passe par une coupure automatique d'une partie du Wi-Fi, ce qui peut impacter la qualité de votre connexion....

item.title: Toyota's Prius Prime saved me gas money but probably not the environment
item.description: I’ve always wondered what it would be like to own a plug-in hybrid, and recently, fate handed me that opportunity. On a recent trip to Vancouver, I rented a 2024 Toyota Prius Prime for nearly two months — the ideal scenario to try out North America’s most popular PHEV. My experience with the Prius Prime Previously, the words "Prius" and "sexy" were rarely used in the same sentence. However, I think the wedge-shaped Prius Prime introduced for 2023 is much sexier than its frumpy predecessors. The sleek shape also pierces the wind better to improve efficiency. It’s lower to the ground than before...

item.title: How to Choose a Computer Monitor (2025): Everything You Need to Know
item.description: Monitors are cheaper, faster, and more beautiful than ever. Here’s how to choose one that will suit your needs and budget.

item.title: The best shows and movies to stream on Netflix in 2025
item.description: Netflix has had an interesting year. Its ad tier, introduced last year, has grown significantly, and its live TV initiative has expanded to include not only weird one-offs like hot-dog-eating grudge matches but also WWE programming. Taking KPop Demon Hunters off Sony's hands for the business equivalent of $200 in a potato chip bag also […]
